intro: Rumex oravicensis, commonly known as the Orava sorrel, is a perennial herb native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive reddish hue. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in several countries.
